title: Microsoft Corp. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
text:
Shares of Microsoft Corp. 
        MSFT,
        -0.15%
       slid 0.68% to $407.54 Monday, on what proved to be an all-around dismal trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index 
        SPX,
        -0.14%
       falling 0.38% to 5,069.53 and Dow Jones Industrial Average 
        DJIA,
        -0.77%
       falling 0.16% to 39,069.23. This was the stock's second consecutive day of losses. Microsoft Corp. closed $13.28 short of its 52-week high ($420.82), which the company reached on February 9th. Despite its losses, the stock outperformed some of its competitors Monday, as Apple Inc. 
        AAPL,
        +0.53%
       fell 0.75% to $181.16, Alphabet Inc. Cl C 
        GOOG,
        +2.04%
       fell 4.50% to $138.75, and Alphabet Inc. Cl A 
        GOOGL,
        +2.15%
       fell 4.44% to $137.57. Trading volume (15.9 M) remained 8.8 million below its 50-day average volume of 24.8 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights, an automation technology provider, using data from Dow Jones and FactSet.  See our market data terms of use.
